channel.title: Some Raps by my Brother-In Law
channel.description:
Alright, well my brother-in law is 24 years old and hes been getting into rapping. I really like his music, he has alot of songs and has been doing this for over 6 years now. His name is Marc. Him and his friend Teddy call themselves Black Label. You can add them on facebook by searching Black Label. Theres a picture of him and his partner Teddy as the display. Theyre just starting to become famous in Detroit and have been noticed by Kid Rock [Country and Rock singer]
So here im just gonna give you a download link with 3 of his songs in it.
He likes to sample and remake songs so if you recodnize some thats why. Ill explain what theyre samples from/what theyre remade from.
Im So Alone The track named "Im So Alone" is sampled from All i Ever Wanted - Basshunter.
Track 14 Track 14 is a remade version of Unforgettable - Drake ft Alicia Keys. The girl that sings in it is actually my sister.
02 Track 2 Track 2 is a remake of Nirvana - Smells like Team Spirit.
Download Link: http://www.mediafire.com/?6cbi947e7mt7d75 Add on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=509123542#!/blacklable247?ref=sgm
Please dont pot on youtube or anything. We dont want it on youtube just yet, and we want it under his account. Thanks!
If you guys like em post here! I really wanna get word of him spread around because i really like his raps. If you dont like try not to make the comments too harsh. Just post what you dont like about it. Thanks for reading!

item.title: Some Raps by my Brother-In Law
item.dc:creator: @orcashark orcashark
item.description:
@orcashark wrote:

Thanks for the positive comments guys!

I was pleasantly surprised by the Nirvana one, that's number 1 chart material I'd say, I'll get listening to the rest. :D

Thanks! I really like that one too.

Read full topic
item.source: Some Raps by my Brother-In Law

item.title: Some Raps by my Brother-In Law
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“The Reaper X, post:8, topic:352258”]He enunciates his words too much.

eg. “I should-int be hEEr” when it should be said “I shudnt be here”

Although his lyrics a better than I expected.[/quote]
Rap is not something you really correct grammer in, otherwise it would just sound even more stupid than it is.

@TOPIC - I wish them luck, I wont be one of the fan’s as i have never found rap that i like, so i have discontinued my listening in that genre.

Read full topic
